com.io7m.r2.core.shaders.provided

Interface R2DepthShaderBasicStippledParametersType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    R2DepthShaderBasicStippledParameters

    public interface R2DepthShaderBasicStippledParametersType
extends R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
    The type of parameters for the basic stippled depth shader.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default R2Texture2DUsableType albedoTexture()
      An albedo map which is used primarily used to determine the opacity of the shaded surface.
      default float alphaDiscardThreshold()
      The threshold value that defines whether or not the surface fragment will be discarded.
      R2Texture2DUsableType stippleNoiseTexture()
      The noise texture used to implement stippling.
      default float stippleThreshold()
      The stipple threshold value.
      R2TextureDefaultsType textureDefaults() 

    • Method Detail

      • textureDefaults

        R2TextureDefaultsType textureDefaults()
        Specified by:
        textureDefaults in interface R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
        Returns:
        A reference to the default textures

      • albedoTexture

        default R2Texture2DUsableType albedoTexture()
        Description copied from interface: R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType

        An albedo map which is used primarily used to determine the opacity of the shaded surface.

        Specified by:
        albedoTexture in interface R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
        Returns:
        The albedo texture for the surface

      • alphaDiscardThreshold

        default float alphaDiscardThreshold()
        Description copied from interface: R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
        The threshold value that defines whether or not the surface fragment will be discarded. If the opacity of the surface is less than this threshold value, the surface will be discarded. A threshold value of 0.0 will result in no fragments ever being discarded.
        Specified by:
        alphaDiscardThreshold in interface R2DepthShaderBasicParametersValuesType
        Returns:
        The threshold value

      • stippleNoiseTexture

        R2Texture2DUsableType stippleNoiseTexture()
        The noise texture used to implement stippling. This is a random noise texture that is tiled across the screen, and values in the red channel are sampled for stippling.
        Returns:
        A noise texture
        See Also:
        stippleThreshold()

      • stippleThreshold

        default float stippleThreshold()
        The stipple threshold value. For each pixel in the surface, the stipple threshold determine whether or not that pixel will be discarded. Essentially, the stippleNoiseTexture() is sampled at each pixel, and if the sampled value is less than stippleThreshold(), the pixel is discarded. Consequently, a stipple threshold of 0.0 never discards pixels.
        Returns:
        The threshold value
